memberdef.definition: typedef b2Contact* b2ContactCreateFcn(b2Fixture *fixtureA, int32 indexA, b2Fixture *fixtureB, int32 indexB, b2BlockAllocator *allocator)
memberdef.argsstring: (b2Fixture *fixtureA, int32 indexA, b2Fixture *fixtureB, int32 indexB, b2BlockAllocator *allocator)
memberdef.name: b2ContactCreateFcn

detaileddescription.para: Friction mixing law. The idea is to allow either fixture to drive the restitution to zero. For example, anything slides on ice.
Restitution mixing law. The idea is allow for anything to bounce off an inelastic surface. For example, a superball bounces on anything.
